author: smartprogrammer
content: <@892053833121923094> i am sure you are already on top of this, but wanted to note for EIP-7702 the importance of fuzzing the new tx type and the athorization list rlp data to make sure all clients deal with it the same way

author: pdobacz
content:
This has been published as an auxiliary release mostly intended to push `evmone` breaking changes in parallel with EEST breaking changes and appease the CIs. Not sure if this is what you're looking for. Maybe try the official EOF prerelease first: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/ , i.e. [this is the newest one](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/eip7692%40v1.0.4)

Not sure what you mean by run a lot of stuff. To run these tests your client must have tooling which consumes the state/blockchain/eof tests JSON formats.

> I am currently trying blockchain tests, what EIPS do I need to activate? ðŸ˜Š
All EOF EIPs on top of Cancun should do (maybe on top of Prague as well, not sure, I'm working on top of Cancun with `evmone`)

author: marioevz
content: As of right now, all eip7692 releases are on top of cancun, so only Cancun+EOF

author: marioevz
content: We don't have fuzzing yet, but will definitely keep it in mind, also we have https://github.com/MariusVanDerWijden/tx-fuzz by <@360491619402776577> , I think this could be a great place to enhance fuzzing of this new tx type

author: marioevz
content: <@226589605816696832> just to be clear, you are refering more about fuzzing the tx-type rlp format to see how each client behaves?
